page.title: 18TWO LOCAL ARTISTS
page.content: Graham Clarke and Brian Higbee are two well-known artists living in Boughton Monchelsea. Many of the paintings they sell are etchings. Graham Clarke's are usually arch-topped, humorous countryside scenes, and he and his friends often appear in them, as do sheep. He thinks that living in the country helps him to paint. His little weatherboarded cottage studio that stands behind his old hall-house has been extended to allow for his interest in printing and silly musical instruments; he has the world's only Gastaphone, made from a guitar, an abacus, and a keyboard. Brian Higbee's pictures tend to be small with intricate detail and depicting flowers, animals and country buildings. One of his chief pastimes is folk-singing, much of which he does for charity.
